'''Alex Lewis''', born and raised in [[Oxford]], England, joined [[The Tolkien Society]] in [[1976]] and was the fifth chairman of the society during [[1988]]-[[1992]]. He was also the editor for the magazine ''[[Nigglings]]''.

He is also a composer known for his song cycles inspired by Tolkien’s First Age tales, The Fall of Gondolin and The Flight of the Noldor.<ref>{{Webcite|articleurl=http://songsofmiddleearth.net/author_en?authorid=192|articlename=Alex Lewis|website=Songs of Middle-earth}}</ref>
